intro: Borreria poaya var. nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined borreria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and have prominent veins, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
